Class summary: OnlineSpeakerClustering implements an online speaker diarization system that clusters speaker embeddings in real time using cosine similarity, dynamically estimating thresholds and speaker counts while managing history and current embedding buffers.

Standalone functions: many getters, merge_vectors, run_reducer, calculate_removable_counts (unused), stitch_cluster_labels (unused). So the module provides utilities for online speaker clustering, with a class that handles real-time diarization, plus helper functions for merging vectors, reducing, etc.

Summary: The module provides an online speaker diarization component that incrementally clusters incoming speaker embeddings. It maintains a history buffer, computes cosine similarity, dynamically adjusts similarity thresholds and estimates the number of active speakers. It leverages offline clustering utilities and linear sum assignment for speaker label alignment. Helper functions support embedding merging, index retrieval, and label stitching.

Business intent: To support applications that require real‑time identification and separation of speakers in audio streams, such as live transcription, meeting analysis, call monitoring, and interactive voice systems.

Keywords list: ["online speaker clustering","real-time diarization","speaker embeddings","cosine similarity","dynamic threshold estimation","speaker count estimation","embedding buffer","PyTorch","linear sum assignment","offline clustering utilities","audio stream processing"].
